name: Preston Crowe
bio: CSE major at the UW interested in network security research, service development, and data visualization. I am passionate about privacy and enjoy building stuff almost as much as I enjoy breaking it.

projects.name: Goodwill Auction Bot
projects.description: Python bot for sniping gamecube controllers, VHS tapes and more on shopgoodwill.com. Sends me email notifications for interesting auctions. Also supports notifications via twitter posts and telegram. Easily customizable.

projects.name: Binance Order Book
projects.description: An implementation of an cryptocurrency oder book built on Binance's API . Listens to Binance's websocket feeds to replicate their order book and compute Bollinger bands in real time.

projects.name: This Website
projects.description: Meta! This website is built with React and SASS and is hosted on an Amazon EC2 instance. All of the content on this page comes from a static config file (src/config.json), so if you like it feel free to clone the project and customize to your liking.

projects.name: Riemann Sums Visualization
projects.description: A tool for educators and students to visualize Riemann sums; the foundation of integral calculus. Use the slider to change n and click the values above the graph to toggle Left, Right, and Trapezoidal sums. Open the menu by clicking the icon in the bottom right or by pressing space.

projects.name: Daiso Puzzle Solver
projects.description: This program recursively discovers all solutions to a silly little puzzle from Daiso Japan. It was developed as a practical example of recursive backtracking for my students and admittedly to satisfy my own curiosity.

projects.name: UNIX Write Annoyware
projects.description: Bug your friends and log their activity on CSE servers by abusing the write command! With no arguments, logs active users to logs/TIMESTAMP.csv. Use the --evil flag to indefinitely spam a message to one or more target ttys.

projects.name: MTG Lifecounter Android App
projects.description: Rewrite of an old project just for funsies, supports 1-2 players and both Standard and EDH formats. Holding buttons increments by 5, tapping increments by 1.
